front.title: Simple Hit-Metering and Usage-Limiting for HTTP

author.organization: Western Research Laboratory, Digital Equipment Corporation

abstract.t: This document proposes a simple extension to HTTP, using a new "Meter" header, which permits a limited form of demographic information (colloquially called "hit-counts") to be reported by caches to origin servers, in a more efficient manner than the "cache-busting" techniques currently used. It also permits an origin server to control the number of times a cache uses a cached response, and outlines a technique that origin servers can use to capture referral information without "cache-busting."
